reviews.text:
Great Classic deli food
Friendly service
Deli atmosphere
Nice place üëå great service üëç
Last kosher deli in the Bronx. Lasted so long due to its curing process of pastrami and corned beef.. so goooD!!!
as expected / scratches the itch

Ordered 1 roast beef sandwich. Cost was almost $30. I will say it was amongst the best roast beef I‚Äôve ever tried in a sandwich. But it was definitely way overpriced. Two regular size slices of bread filled with generous sized amount of roast beef. The taste of the beef was very very good I will say. What got me was the price. I don‚Äôt think it was $30 worth of flavor.

It was a Sunday, October 12th,2025 my husband and I (both in our 70's)was on our way home from Church Service decided we wanted pastrami sandwiches. My daughter had order from Libmen's for herself and her 92yr old grandmother, they both enjoyed the sandwiches, so we drove uptown to Liebman's. We ordered 3 pastrami sandwiches on a roll and Cole slaw with my Latino brother behind the counter.We spend about $92 with taxes and fees for using a credit card. We received our order drop off my daughter's sandwich could not wait to get home and eat ours. We were never so upset and disappointed.  These sandwiches was made with scrapes (fall away meat after you've sliced a slice,shavings). I checked with my daughter and her's was the same. We didn't want to go back to the restaurant and make a scene, return the sandwiches and demand our money back. We would have been well within our rights but instead we made 2 half sandwiches with the 2 whole sandwiches.  The rest of it went to the garbage. Total DISRESPECT!!!!
I called the next day to speak to the manager.  The lady who answered the phone told me to hold on when she came back told me that he was busy took my name and phone# told me he would üìû me, until now I am still waiting.ü§® We come to your establishment in good faith to spend our money with our Jewish Brothers and get a good product not your garage you want to get rid of. Everyone who come to your establishment should be respected.We were DISRESPECTED in your Deli because they felt comfortable treating us that way but stuff like that comes from the top. So I say to Liebman's üí∞ is hard to come by and if you want to continue in business you must treat EVERYONE the same. I WILL NOT RETURN TO Liebman's to be DISRESPECTED AGAIN.I WILL TELL OTHERS I KNOW ABOUT MY EXPERIENCE. People of a different or darker hue BEWARE U MAY NOT BE TREATED THE SAME. Had I ordered on line would my sandwiches be better because then you would not know that I was a Black Women.ü§îü§®üò°
In my opinion this is the place for true New York deli. Do not miss the pickles they are made in house and are amazing.  The corned beef and pastrami are second to none.

Last week me, and my partner went  to Lieberman‚Äòs for the first time. We gave it a two star for not sitting us quickly. With a table not being used, and the place not being crowded. But what really bothered us, was that the person that took our order was the same person picking up dirty dishes from other tables. No gloves on!!! We will not be going back. Just saying!ü§®

The food was phenomenal, definitely better than Katz. We received generous portions and the food itself was fresh and delicious! The staff was friendly, attentive, and kind. We will definitely be back!
Excellent food and service
Probably the best pastrami in New York.
Was absolutely not happy with brisket sandwich. Asked for fatty and juicy but got more bread than meat. Might be spoiled since I grew up near Katz. Maybe I'll try the pastrami next time
The pastrami and corned beef were phenomenal as always.  Fast friendly service too.
Excellent pastrami!

Great pastrami and corned beef.  Really enjoyed the included side of coleslaw and pickles. You do not need a side of fries or a knish, but get one anyway. Only downside was being so full I had to waddle home.
Legendary New York Jewish deli
Take out food , always happy
This place would get 10 stars if I could. Amazing food, cool diner vibe, awesome staff, and great neighborhood culture. I'll be going back to try more items on the menu!

Authentic old school Jewish deli serving all the classics. Pastrami, corned beef, best hot dogs, macaroni salad, cucumber salad, half sour pickles plus an extensive menu of entrees. Great stuffed cabbage. It‚Äôs expensive ($25-29 for a sandwich) but one sandwich can easily feed 2 people. Besides, having an authentic old school deli meal is priceless.

We dropped my grandson off for his 1st year of college at the University of Mt Saint Vincent and someone told us about this restaurant. It was so awesome and the closes to Slymans in Cleveland but Liebmans had wayyyyy more of a variety of foods and our waiter was soooo nice. What an awesome experience.
First time here and they treated me great, the food was fantastic!
Muhammad our waiter was without a doubt so far one of my favorite people I've encountered here in NYC! Try the reuben and thank me later.
Awesome pastrami

I have always wanted to visit this deli and went there one day with my family. We were blown away by the great tasting food we ordered. Everything was perfect and our waiter along with the staff were excellent and treated us like they knee us for years. We can't wait to come back to Liebman's again. I would highly recommend this delicious anyone.
Bueno bonito y barato
The ladies room was pristine.
Last of the old time NY delis.  Staff is great, some food like the chopped liver and vegetable soup are standouts
Best Corned beef sandwich ever.
Great overall dining experience. Excellent food!
Staff is very friendly and nice. They always greeting you and make you feel welcome

The hot pastrami sandwich was transcendent.  An absolutely magical experience.

The deli is not pretentious.  It has a simple sophistication which defined the standard.
Expensive

Nestled within the hilly terrain of the  Riverdale neighborhood in the Bronx this restaurant offers delicious kosher offerings. The pastrami was as good as any I tasted, the matzo ball soup had noodles (which was the 1st time I experienced), and the chocolate egg cream made for a complete, delicious lunch.

Another thing that is great about this deli was that there is a parking lot around the corner on Johnson Avenue. It maybe out of the way from most parts of the city but if one has a vehicle it's relatively easy to get here.

Mile high piled sandwiches! Absolutely delicious üòã
Coney Island Square Knish was great too
Love the Metallica-styled Deli shirts!!
Great
Beware! There is no hashkacha at all! It's not actually kosher.
Classic place that's been around for decades in Ruverdale. Equally as good if not better than Katz's with great service.
Very clean.. delicious food! Will definitely recommend
One word: MMMMMM

A gem found in the Bronx! I believe the pastrami (got the overstuffed on a Kaiser) is in my top three of the NYC boroughs! The matzah ball soup with noodles and bits of fresh chicken is to die for! Flavorful and lasting taste soup. The pastrami taste and texture is what I call A1 triple stars. Exactly how I've always liked my pastrami!  The knish was okay it was good on the inside but tough on the outside. I also wished it was warmer and perhaps, fresher. Almost forgot, coleslaw and pickles were awesome too! This was on a Sunday and it got a bit crowded but not too bad about 12:15pm. Before then it was quite quiet and chill. Service is OUTSTANDING!
Great Friendly Service. Food is amazing! Our waitress Tina is the best, professional and super friendly. Well be back!!!

IMHO, still the best pastrami in NYC. Excellent brisket, too. Have with full sour pickles, cole slaw, a square potato knish, and Cel-Ray. Kudos to excellent waiter, Mohammed, for superb, congenial, attentive service!
Did a pickup order of the corned beef and pastrami platter.  The food was excellent!  The price was reasonable!
Great Customer service
The best Jewish deli for miles around. The food is amazing. Atmosphere decent. Pricing not bad for the quality offered.
great food !...very reasonable prices too !...I'll go from cape ann mass to the deli  because it's that good !
Kosher deli exactly the way it should be.

We always order their Pastrami Reuben sandwich, which comes with coleslaw. Everything was fresh whenever we stopped by. Around lunchtime, it gets crowded, but the quality of food and service outweighs the wait time. The portions are big, and we always split the dish between the two of us.

Old school and authentic Jewish deli.  The waiters here are all in their 60s.  The pastrami was a bit fatty.  The matzo ball soup was perfectly good. The pickles are good.  They were out of chicken liver. üò§. The can of coke was overpriced. The cabbage roll was very sweet and was not made with rice

The height of these pastrami or corned beef, etc sandwiches exceeds all expectations, and the quality of the pastrami, corned beef, etc in those divine sandwiches is the epitome of excellent deli fare. To taste is to believe!

I‚Äôve always wanted to visit here and for someone who‚Äôs grown up and lived in the NYC area most of my life I don‚Äôt know what took me so long!  So on Sunday my wife and I schlepped up to the Bronx from the Upper West Side‚Ä¶and I‚Äôm glad we did.  To make what could be a long review short‚Ä¶Liebman‚Äôs is as good a deli as I‚Äôve ever been too.  That includes all of the great NYC delis‚Ä¶Katz‚Äôs, Second Avenue Deli, Stage Deli (in its prime), Carnegie, Pastrami Queen to mention a few.

The pastrami, the corned beef, the knishes, French fries and matzo ball soup were what we hope for when we step into a deli.  May this place (and other delis) thrive for generations.

Always have great service, It‚Äôs the only Deli We have ever been to,Just stick to a family favorite

My favorite meal is The Liebman‚Äôs Favorite
half Pastrami and half Corned beef Rye Bread with fried potatoes ,Kishka,brown gravy, coleslaw & pickles Really good really filling
Just loved this place. Very clean and our food was delicious. We had chopped liver, matzo ball soup, stuffed cabbage and giant brisket and pastrami sandwiches. A very very comprehensive menu.

One of the best pastrami sandwiches in NYC hands down! Can it compare to Katzs? Yes indeed! Mountains of meat and full of the right flavors! Amazing experience!  Staff is very friendly. Thoroughly enjoyed it!

Walked in right when it opened on a Tuesday morning at 11am. I was the first to sit down for table service and was quickly greeted by Jodi.

She was very sweet and I told her that I was on a mission to try the Pastrami Rueben so she put in my order along with a Dr. Brown‚Äôs Root beer soda right away.

My order came with coleslaw and two halves of deli pickles

The wait wasn‚Äôt long. It was about 10 minutes from when I sat down that Jodi was on her way bringing my pastrami. She very kind to hand me my root beer beforehand.

Between two slices of toasted rye, with a nice layer of Russian dressing sauerkraut, stood this mini-mound of delicious looking pastrami. It smelled great because it seemed like when they cut the sandwich in half, I think they press that side onto the flat top making that edge nice and crispy but not disturbing the rest of the soft meat that‚Äôs in the sandwich.

It was great, the pastrami wasn‚Äôt too hot, nice and warm. The creaminess from the Russian dressing along with the sauerkraut compliments the pastrami very well. The rye although lightly toasted, doesn‚Äôt stay very crunchy because the heat from within the sandwhich itself softens it up, yet the bread didn‚Äôt get soggy.

The slaw and the pickles add the extra crunchiness that you may be looking for incase the sauerkraut doesn‚Äôt suffice. Is it necessary? Maybe some people may find it to be too much food, but for me, you can‚Äôt go wrong with slaw and pickles when you‚Äôre eating a great pastrami sandwich.

The atmosphere was great, feels like an old-school diner from when I was growing up. From what I saw, there were a number of original art pieces hung throughout the dining room. And it seems as if they were all from different artists.. I‚Äôd like to look into them next time I visit.

The lighting is nice. Soft white lights.. compliments the art pieces and it lights up everything nicely. Allows for a nice sit down alone or amongst family and friends.

Overall, I can‚Äôt wait to go back. Next time I‚Äôd like to bring my family. There is something for everyone on the menu. I‚Äôm glad they have a kids menu (for the picky eaters) and they also had a selection of desserts. I shared my pictures in the menu section but I will also share them here.

$ Price-wise‚Ä¶
Pastrami and similar meats are not cheap.
Am I okay with what I paid? Yes. The food was delicious, the service was great, and the timing was outstanding. I‚Äôd like to revisit during a lunch or possibly a dinner rush. I don‚Äôt think food quality will be affected but I‚Äôm intrigued to see how long my wait time will be. Am I worried, not at all, just as long as the food is good.. and so far they‚Äôre batting 1000%.

Thank you Liebman‚Äôs, can‚Äôt wait to go back.

Welcome to The Bronx! Pastrami, Kasha Varnishkas, Round Knishes, Matzah Ball soup, half and full sour pickles, slaw, whitefish salad and coffee. See Mohamed for excellent service. Free parking in the Key Food lot behind the deli. Highly recommended.

Today, April 22, 2023, I took a three hour schlep from South Brooklyn to Riverdale up in da Bronx to Liebman's Kosher Delicatessen & Restaurant at 552 W 235th St, Bronx, NY 10463. Now I have a soft spot for this place, because my aunt Joan and Uncle Bill z"l lived a couple of blocks away and had Liebman's cater all their simchas. Sadly, they've been gone for over 15 years, so it's been a while.
I arrived at Liebman's around noon, having left home around 9am and I was hungry. The first thing I noticed is that the place had had a facelift and that it was a lot brighter and cheerful than it had been in the past. Being the last day for the Riverdale Restaurant Week Special, I went for it, ordering a Pastrami on rye, full sour pickles, a square knish and a Dr. Brown's Cel-Ray from my friendly and attentive waiter for the unbelievable price of only $20. By the time I got back from the sparkling clean rest room, everything was laid out at my table and I was ready to feast!
The generous standard (as opposed to the overstuffed which would have been $5 extra and worth every penny) 12 oz. of pastrami was machine sliced, but thicker than Sarge's and Pastrami Queen. It was glistening with fat, had a nice crust of spices and a noticeable smoke ring. It was beautifully tender and juicy, nicely smoky and had just the perfect amount of salt. It was the best Kosher pastrami I've had in NYC, and I'd rank it just under Katz's pastrami for flavor and tenderness; definitely worth the trip.
The Cole slaw was shaved thin, but retained it's crispiness. It was some of the freshest and tastiest I've had in a while. The pickles, while being juicy and garlicky, were nice and crispy, not mushy like pickles in a lot of places. They made a wonderful palate cleanser in-between bites of sandwich and sips of Cel-Ray.
When, not if, I return, I'm going to try the overstuffed version, which at $26.99 is still a bargain for an overstuffed Kosher pastrami sandwich.
In my humble opinion, Liebman's Kosher Delicatessen & Restaurant is worth the trip!
Classic deli/ diner... The quality was phenomenal.  You could tell why this has been an establishment in the neighborhood.  I wish I lived closer!!

One of the lasts of a dying breed. I truly believe Liebmans pastrami is the best of the Jewish delis in NYC. Thin sliced, juicy, and fatty. So delicious. Amazing pickles and cole slaw. Really enjoyed the square knish also. The mustard is a real nice addition. Of course, have to wash it down with Dr. browns root beer!
First time here. Chicken soup and Pastrami was the best. Friendliest people I've ever met. The Riverdale area in the Bronx is the best place.

A time capsule of Jewish deli culture. First rate classic deli dishes. Pastrami that can't be beat. Incredible matzo ball soup.  If this was in Manhattan there would be lines out the door. Worth the pilgrimage and then some.

I went there about three weeks ago, thinking that the restaurant was a Westchester Katz deli well to my disappointment not at all can touch Katz. I first ordered the hotdog with me and my niece. It was terrible and the saut√©ed onions were very greasy. Then I ordered the pastrami Ruben why did they give me pastrami on toast. The bread was so hard. A piece was broken off when he served me my plate. The best thing that I had there was the thousand hour dressing. The pickles taste like they were from a supermarket. They will never get my money again all that money for nothing go to Katz in New York City.

Enjoyed some fresh pastrami and rye sandwich with some pickles on the side. Sandwich was delicious and definitely recommend. this establishment has been here since 1953.  Great Jewish deli, food is excellent as well as the ambiance, also old time music playing in the background.
Wide ranging menu of traditional Jewish deli food. Sandwiches were huge. Great corned beef and pastrami

We ordered here for dinner last night. The food from this place was excellent! We had the meatloaf, corned beef and pastrami, potato knishes and babka. Large portions and really fresh tasting food! Even leftovers were delicious. Definitely planning to order from here again.

Old world charm with super-friendly staff.
Ordered the combination Pastrami & Corned Beef sandwich which comes stacked high with loads of finely sliced meats. My wife and I had were full eating just one sandwich! They also plunked down a bowl of pickles and coleslaw - probably the best I have ever had.
Its a must do for anyone who is trying the NY City of old movies. Make sure you are not in a rush when you visit them in the Bronx - its a place to experience and take in.

Pastrami is very good and egg salad
sandwich itself is little less thicker than Katz deli
price is almost the same as Katz in nyc thus the 4 star

Authentic Jewish deli, of which there aren't that many, I think. Food is great. Service is prompt and a part of the place. The price of a corned beef or other sandwich can be a bit alarming at first glance - but this is the good stuff and‚Ä¶
Got # 7 and matzoh ball soup and both were delicious. This is a hidden gem in the Bronx. I won‚Äôt mind coming to here to eat again.
The food was good I recommend their beef tongue sandwiches with the cherry pepper mayo. Also, I recommend their oat milk egg cream almost as good as the original with cow's milk.

Went with my colleague to grab a sandwich  ü•™  and that's all it took...the flavor of the Pastrami sandwich was excellent! I highly recommend this venue if you are looking to get a tasty sandwich.

Thank you for the food and service!

We opted to try a deli that was not commercialized/overridden with Instagrammers! And boy are we happy with that!

Liebmans is on the outskirts of the Bronx! A very nice little neighborhood, a bit of a drive of course out of New York City but well worth it.

The smoked salmon is the best I have ever tasted! Kind of like a nova lox. It is so fresh, sweet, salty but mild. There was a lot of fattiness to the salmon which made it even tastier! Their sides are to die for as well, the potato salad was so masterfully seasoned.

And onto their deli sandwich, stacked so high with nicely sliced pieces of pastrami! And they gave some delicious homemade mustard too. Great service, friendly staff, and felt very much like eating at home. Such a comfortable and inviting environment. So many locals you can see coming here, elderly ones that know exactly this is the place to be if you want a satisfaction guaranteed meal! Can‚Äôt wait till the borders open again so that I can drive here from Canada!
A great pastrami sandwich!! Everything is good there. A very friendly grandpa always makes customers happy.
